paragraphs.text: If you organized a pickup tournament among the best players from UNC, Duke, and Kentucky over the last decade, the former Tar Heels would get run off the floor. Williams hasn’t coached a single NBA All-Star in his 14 seasons in Chapel Hill. Calipari had Devin Booker (who dropped 70 points on the Celtics over the weekend) coming off his bench in 2015. The best NBA players Williams has produced at UNC are Danny Green, Lawson, and Harrison Barnes. Yet despite the disparity in talent, Williams has had just as much success as his peers at other blue-blood programs.
paragraphs.name: 5bcb

55d8bd177613.title: So the market inefficiency is to not get the top 10 recruits?

paragraphs.text: So the market inefficiency is to not get the top 10 recruits? Well then everyone outside of Duke and UK are playing the game right, huh? The fact that UNC is still getting consistent top25/50 McD’s All American recruits doesn’t mean they have some crazy secret plan to succeed, they just get good players that stay beyond 1 year. Michigan State has been doing this for 15 years.
paragraphs.name: f287

7bc483231f45.title: that one All-Star Coach K had?…its

paragraphs.text: that one All-Star Coach K had?…its the guy that only had his expert tutelage for 16 games….totally don’t understand why they choose Dook, K’s record with producing NBA talent is squat, most of the one-and-done crowd are leaving whatever school they go to after one year anyways, why go somewhere where everyone outside of Durham, New Jersey, and some parts of Asia are going to hate you?
paragraphs.name: e0c5

f7a8fbbbe5d2.title: This piece is great except Roy Williams has won 2 national championships while at Carolina — in…

paragraphs.text: This piece is great except Roy Williams has won 2 national championships while at Carolina — in 2005 and 2009. So he will be going for his third.
paragraphs.name: f7f0

7c3e7e9e40dc.title: Roy just has a great system and knows how to recruit to fill it.

paragraphs.text: Roy just has a great system and knows how to recruit to fill it. They haven’t hit on a great one and done, but it doesn’t matter. UNC always has fantastic athletes and out-rebounds teams to death. Withe athletes Roy recruits UNC contends for titles in the years they get great point guard play.
paragraphs.name: a0b1

484fda388a3d.title: I think the UNC special sauce is their absurd offensive rebounding rates, almost always near 50…

paragraphs.text: I think the UNC special sauce is their absurd offensive rebounding rates, almost always near 50% and top three in the nation. When you have A- talent and give yourself that many extra chances, you’re not losing unless the other team is really good and plays near perfect ball.
paragraphs.name: 5ad1

5ca05b9718f6.title: Williams-UNC gets top recruits every season, so I’m not sure what the point of this article is.

paragraphs.text: Williams-UNC gets top recruits every season, so I’m not sure what the point of this article is. That these STAY for more than a season, often hurting themselves in the NBA draft when they do leave UNC, is the real phenomenon.
paragraphs.name: 6d48

e368a1234ab8.title: One-and-dones can stop attending class after a couple of months.

paragraphs.text: One-and-dones can stop attending class after a couple of months. UNC players have historically not had to go at all.

2d4306c22d28.title: Since the start of the one and done era, you’ve got two national champions — Kentucky in 2012 and…

paragraphs.text: Since the start of the one and done era, you’ve got two national champions — Kentucky in 2012 and Duke in 2015 — that leaned heavily on one and done talent to win their titles. Duke’s 2010 bunch was (if my Tar Heel biased memory is accurate) junior and senior heavy between Kyle Singler-John Scheyer-Greg Holy Shit I Can’t Believe Your Goon Ass Became…

paragraphs.text: As I watched the footage of Fox getting emotional in the locker room after the game last weekend, I couldn’t help but think “If you’re this passionate about the teammates you had and the run you went on, why not try to convince everybody to come back…” Is there any doubt that Kentucky would be a juggernaut if…

5911ae73b001.title: I think a lot of people don’t realize how much better players get during the course of their…

paragraphs.text: I think a lot of people don’t realize how much better players get during the course of their college careers. Most players are just much, much better at 21 or 22 than at 18 or 19. Any player that is good enough to be an average NBA starter for a few years is most likely going to be really good as junior or senior in college. Ty Lawson, for example…
paragraphs.name: 2fbf

5d4119c7fe9c.title: Every team needs upperclassman to be successful.

paragraphs.text: Every team needs upperclassman to be successful. While the Duke team in 2015 was led by freshman, when I watched Quinn Cook dive off the raised court for a loose ball, then get up screaming at his freshman teammates motivating them, I knew the game was over against Wisconsin. His presence on the court made the freshman play like upperclassman which eliminated Wisconsin’s biggest advantage going in.
paragraphs.name: 7f06

21cfc6bc56e5.title: In 2014, according to ESPN’s recruiting rankings, Jackson was #8, Pinson #10 and Berry #17.

paragraphs.text: In 2014, according to ESPN’s recruiting rankings, Jackson was #8, Pinson #10 and Berry #17. Meanwhile, Stanley Johnson was #7, KAT #9, Kelly Oubre #11, Justice Winslow #15 and Devin Booker #17. My question, essentially, is how is Roy, to his benefit, able to get kids so highly ranked but not elite enough to be one and dones? Is he actually trying to…
